description: Structured extraction of methodological practices from 126 ML papers in environmental adsorption/degradation prediction. This is the analysis corpus used in the published review.
source: LLM-assisted extraction (Qwen3.5-Plus) from MinerU-converted fulltext, validated against 10-paper gold standard (83.8/100 accuracy). Low-accuracy fields manually corrected across all 126 papers.

parent_dataset.name: ml4env_155_dataset
parent_dataset.note: The initial corpus contained 155 papers. 29 papers were excluded during quality screening.

reasons: Paper 66: off-topic (Antarctic climate study, not ML for environmental remediation)
Paper 81: insufficient ML content (purely experimental, no ML modeling)
Paper 119: duplicate study (same dataset and model as another included paper)
26 additional papers excluded during relevance screening (not ML-based prediction of adsorption/degradation)

post_processing: mechanistic_discussion set to false when interpretability_methods=['none']
Pollutant names standardized (e.g., MB -> Methylene Blue, Pb2+ -> Pb(II))
Material names standardized (e.g., biochar -> Biochar, mof -> MOF)
Algorithm names standardized per mapping (e.g., BP -> ANN, MLR -> LR, GBRT -> GBM)
Low-accuracy fields manually reviewed: feature_selection_method, materials, pollutants, target_variable.name

fields.dataset_size: Total ML data points used (train + test combined, integer or null)
fields.n_literature_sources: Number of source papers if data_source=literature (integer or null)
fields.target_variable_name: Standardized target variable: qmax | removal_efficiency | rate_constant | log_Kd | adsorption_capacity | selectivity | uptake | other
fields.target_variable_name_original: Original target variable name as used in the paper
fields.target_variable_unit: Unit of target variable (mg/g, %, min-1, mmol/g, etc.)
fields.target_variable_range_min: Minimum value of target in dataset (numeric or null)
fields.target_variable_range_max: Maximum value of target in dataset (numeric or null)
fields.data_selection_criteria_described: Whether data selection/filtering criteria are explicitly described (boolean)
fields.data_preprocessing: List of preprocessing steps: normalization | standardization | log_transform | outlier_removal | missing_value_imputation | one_hot_encoding | label_encoding | none_reported
fields.validation_method: Primary validation strategy: random_split | k_fold | LOOCV | external | nested_cv | none_reported
fields.k_fold_k: K value if k-fold CV used (integer or null)
fields.train_test_ratio: Train:test split ratio as string (e.g., 80:20) or null
fields.grouped_splitting: Whether data was grouped by study/material/pollutant before splitting (boolean)
fields.best_metric_value: Best reported metric value on test/validation set (numeric or null)
fields.best_rmse: Best RMSE on test/validation set (numeric or null)
fields.reports_train_and_test: Reports performance metrics for both training and test sets (boolean)
fields.external_validation: Tested on truly independent external dataset (boolean)
fields.n_features: Total number of input features (integer or null)
fields.hyperparameter_tuning: Tuning method: grid_search | random_search | bayesian | genetic | none_reported
fields.best_algorithm: Best performing algorithm using standardized abbreviation
fields.interpretability_methods: List: SHAP | LIME | PDP | feature_importance | sensitivity_analysis | none
fields.n_features_used: Number of features in final model (integer or null)
fields.feature_selection_method: correlation | PCA | RFE | mutual_information | manual | none_reported
fields.top_3_features: Top 3 most important features as reported
fields.mechanistic_discussion: Connects ML interpretability results to known physical/chemical mechanisms (boolean)
fields.ml_algorithms: List of all ML algorithms used (standardized abbreviations)
fields.evaluation_metrics: List of all evaluation metrics reported: R2 | RMSE | MAE | MAPE | MSE | R | NSE | other
fields.software_tools: Programming languages/tools: Python | MATLAB | R | Weka | SPSS | JMP | other
fields.compared_with_prior_work: Explicitly compares with previously published ML models (boolean)
fields.discusses_scalability: Discusses scale-up or practical application potential (boolean)
fields.engineering_validation: ML predictions validated with engineering/pilot-scale data (boolean)

algorithm_standardization.GBM: Gradient Boosting Machine (covers GBRT, GBR, GBDT, LsBoost)
algorithm_standardization.ANN: Artificial Neural Network (covers MLP, BP, BPNN, FFNN)
